flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: As a volunteer at the sustainable garden on the campus of Union College, I quickly found that the garden shed was in need of lighting. As an aspiring electrical engineer, I decided to take on a project that involved a solar panel powered electrical system for the shed. With no renewable energy system experience, I enlisted the help of a Mechanical Engineering professor to help us with the design of such a system. A design was created, components were purchased, and a solar powered electrical system for our campus' sustainable garden was implemented!
guide.introduction_rendered: As a volunteer at the sustainable garden on the campus of Union College, I quickly found that the garden shed was in need of lighting. As an aspiring electrical engineer, I decided to take on a project that involved a solar panel powered electrical system for the shed. With no renewable energy system experience, I enlisted the help of a Mechanical Engineering professor to help us with the design of such a system. A design was created, components were purchased, and a solar powered electrical system for our campus' sustainable garden was implemented!

lines.text: Please refer to the parts list at the beginning of this guide for a complete list of parts needed for the completion of this project.
lines.text_raw: Please refer to the parts list at the beginning of this guide for a complete list of parts needed for the completion of this project.

guide.summary: This project outlines the design and implementation of a solar panel powered lighting and electrical system inside of the shed at Union College's sustainable garden.
guide.title: Electrification of Union College's Garden Shed using Solar Power
